intro: Descurainia ramosissima, commonly known as prairie sandparsley, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils. It has small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to colonize disturbed areas.
